definitions.definition: a separate section of a train for carrying passengers
a road vehicle, usually with four wheels, that is pulled by one or more horses and was used in the past to carry people

examples.text: A horse and carriage awaited the happy couple.
She arrived at the ball in horse-drawn carriage.
She went for a ride in the carriage that afternoon.
The queen waved from her ceremonial carriage.
They could hear the sound of carriage wheels on the gravel.

definitions.definition: the act or cost of transporting goods from one place to another

examples.text: Orders are despatched within 28 days but allow time for carriage.
a contract for the carriage of goods

definitions.definition: a moving part of a machine that supports or moves another part, for example on a typewriter

examples.text: a carriage return *(= the act of starting a new line when typing)*

definitions.definition: the way in which somebody holds and moves their head and body

examples.text: She showed her pedigree on her face and in her carriage.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Old Northern French cariage, from carier, based on Latin carrus ‘wheeled vehicle’.
